DataElement.preferredName: Gliomatosis Cerebri Post Brain Neoplasm Surgery Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to indicate the presence of Gliomatosis cerebri following brain tumor surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gliomatosis Cerebri Post Brain Neoplasm Surgery Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Gliomatosis cerebri (WHO grade II) is a diffuse glial tumor which infiltrates the brain, extensively, involving more than two lobes. It is frequently bilateral and often extends to the infratentorial structures, even to the spinal cord. It is probably of astrocytic origin, although GFAP expression may be scant or absent. (Adapted form WHO.)_Post; occuring after._Benign and malignant neoplasms that arise from or metastasize to structures within the cranium.  This includes meningeal and other tumors that occur in the spaces that surround the brain, and neoplasms of the brain._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Gliomatosis cerebri (WHO grade II) is a diffuse glial tumor which infiltrates the brain, extensively, involving more than two lobes. It is frequently bilateral and often extends to the infratentorial structures, even to the spinal cord. It is probably of astrocytic origin, although GFAP expression may be scant or absent. (Adapted form WHO.)

Concepts.definition: A diffuse glial tumor which infiltrates the brain extensively, involving more than two lobes. It is frequently bilateral and often extends to the infratentorial structures, even to the spinal cord. It is probably of astrocytic origin, although GFAP expression may be scant or absent. (Adapted from WHO.)

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Benign and malignant neoplasms that arise from or metastasize to structures within the cranium.  This includes meningeal and other tumors that occur in the spaces that surround the brain, and neoplasms of the brain.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from or metastasizes to the brain.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
